title: MAVEN SWIA (Solar Wind Ion Analyzer) Level 2 Coarse 3D Distributions Survey Telemetry  - J.S. Halekas (U Iowa)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/maven/swia/l2/coarsesvy3d/2014/03/mvn_swi_l2_coarsesvy3d_20140319_v02_r00.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 7.7348% of the 42 timesteps. Cadence = 64000084160 [ns] = PT1M4.000084S.

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Time, start of sample, in TT2000 time base

parameters.name: diff_en_fluxes
parameters.description: Calibrated Differential Energy Flux [vary with time, energy, deflection index and anode angle] at 1st deflection index[Thumbnails, select a few hours]

parameters.name: diff_en_fluxes_mv
parameters.description: ---> Movie of above [flux vs. energy and anode angle]. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['diff_en_fluxes']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: diff_en_fluxes_spec1
parameters.description: ---> Spectrogram at selected Azimuth Angle bins 1,4,7,10,13,16. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['diff_en_fluxes'].
